name: TheAtlantic
text: “MasterClass’s mission, as it was originally defined, was to ‘democratize access to genius,’” @Carina_Chocano writes. “But the service actually offers something different—­although what that is, exactly, is hard to put your finger on.” https://t.co/KUqlV36ob9

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @stacyfmitchell: The outcome of the House's Big Tech probe will speak to two of the biggest questions we face: One is whether the tech giants will continue to wield outsize power. The other is whether we’re still capable of governing ourselves.

My piece in @TheAtlantic: 
https://t.co/sHhAMECsCt

name: TheAtlantic
text: August is typically the worst month of the Chernobyl fire season, and this year, public anxiety is mounting, writes @JBraxtonLittle: https://t.co/v6vxgbmVMo

name: TheAtlantic
text: The problem, @stacyfmitchell writes, is that "the machinery of government has been dysfunctional for so long that Americans forget it even exists. This is especially true when it comes to questions of how the economy is structured." https://t.co/IkDrhNaxMK

name: TheAtlantic
text: The arrest of a prodemocracy newspaper owner is the latest sign of the alarming erosion of freedoms in Hong Kong. @TMclaughlin3 writes of the authorities' doublespeak, and how trust is plummeting in the city: https://t.co/gVp4XsWRDY
